storyInfo: Parliament's provisional court puts Millscar on trial for its crimes, but the namesake leader herself forfeits her right to a defense. Vina issues an arrest warrant and orders the neutralization of the organization's members.

attributes.content: <p=1>The Sineselde, Parliamentary Chamber</><p=2>December 15th, 1098, 4:02 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: I brought the Defense Forces files that were requested.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Madam Speaker, since the establishment of the patrols, we have received no fewer than two hundred requests for assistance involving Millscar and her followers.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: There is concrete evidence of their violation of Parliament's newly-enacted laws.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: What are we waiting for? They're getting in the way of honest people doing honest work! Give the order! Put their heads on pikes outside the Sineselde!
attributes.name: Rowdy MP

attributes.content: Feist and Rockrock have already reported the situation to me.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I want the rebuilding to progress smoothly as much as you do, but that's not how Parliament works.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Go ahead, Viscount Elsa.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Millscar's behavior is certainly questionable, but their medicine has at least provided consolation to those suffering from the current shortage, if nothing else—
attributes.name: Reserved MP

attributes.content: Balderdash!
attributes.name: Angry MP

attributes.content: They're exacting payment in lives!
attributes.name: Angry MP

attributes.content: Sit DOWN, Lord Alan! You are in Parliament!
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: They are using underground facilities, relics from the war, to evade our pursuit, Viscount Elsa.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: They've been decentralizing their operations, of course, but there is also evidence indicating that someone associated with Parliament is helping them.
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: I believe we need an explanation for that, don't we?
attributes.name: Horn

attributes.content: Are the Londinium Defense Forces requesting our assistance with the investigation, Lieutenant Skamandros?
attributes.name: Reserved MP

attributes.content: We are, of course, eager to help the citizens face the Millscar threat. I could contact Her Grace the Duke of Caster to arrange for personnel to be deployed to Londinium—
attributes.name: Reserved MP

attributes.content: It is much reassuring to hear that Her Grace the Duke of Caster has, at long last, deigned to generously offer her valuable assistance to Parliament, Viscount Elsa. I am very curious to know if other dukes will do the same.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Baron Hector, Viscount Gideon, Dr. Herman, and Academician Erwin... may I trust you to pass on the message to the other dukes should you, by chance, have the opportunity to communicate with them?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Startled, the members whose names are called, who have been keeping a low profile in the room, are left with little choice but to smile and bow to Vina.
There is no affirmation or denial, but the argument in the chamber has evaporated, as though it never existed to begin with.
A special provisional court will be convened of the Members of Parliament to deal with the Millscar issue. Millscar will, of course, be granted the opportunity to present her defense.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: There is whispering amongst the seats, but no objections.
Will she show up for the trial, though?
attributes.name: MP

attributes.content: If she does not appear, she will forfeit her right to a defense, and the court shall pass judgment in a fair and just manner.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Horn, kindly instruct patrols to take Millscar into custody and bring her to the Parliamentary Chamber.
attributes.name: Vina
Vina
attributes.content: Prior to Parliament's recess today...

attributes.name: Vina
attributes.content: She has two hours. I will wait for her here.
You should wait in the office, get some rest. You don't look so well.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I'll let you know if she comes—
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I said, I'll wait here!
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Right then.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Sorry. I'm just—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I know.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I don't understand. There are so many things that are much more urgent—Infected in need of treatment, shortage of supplies, rebuilding the city, restoring order...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: My desk is constantly covered in important matters that require my attention.
attributes.name: Vina
Vina
attributes.content: But they would rather spend an entire day bickering over something that they don't even disagree about—

attributes.name: Vina
attributes.content: *sigh*...
I'm not doing a good enough job.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I remember that I promised you she would not get away, if you give my people and the Defense Forces free rein to search for her.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: We're short-handed. Trying to solve the problem this way means ignoring other, more urgent problems in the city—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Then why do you think you're not doing a good enough job?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Don't try to carry a nomadic city on your back. That's what the tracks underneath it are for.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: You don't have to become the perfect leader that they talk about, for whom solving every single problem is taken for granted.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Besides... from Millscar to the protests to the medicine shortage, the shadow of the dukes loom large over all these recent affairs.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: There is no doubt that Caster is behind the Millscar matter, but something has to give. Millscar has gone too far.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Catching her is no easy task, though. Indra and Dagda say she has associated with a strange Vampire.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Delphine... if she doesn't show—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Do you want her to, Vina?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: <p=1>Millscar Hideout</><p=2>December 15th, 1098, 5:17 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Wh-Why are you blindfolding me? I've paid my husband's bill!
attributes.name: Frightened Woman

attributes.content: Yes, ma'am, you're an honest woman.
attributes.name: Calm Mercenary

attributes.content: You have paid the bill of Mickey Robinson. The boss sends her condolences. Your husband made many contributions to the city.
attributes.name: Calm Mercenary

attributes.content: C-Can I go now?
attributes.name: Frightened Woman

attributes.content: Of course. Once you've paid your other debt, that is.
attributes.name: Calm Mercenary

attributes.content: Two contracts. One, signed by your husband, the one you just paid. Another, signed by you on behalf of your husband.
attributes.name: Calm Mercenary

attributes.content: But he's gone!
attributes.name: Frightened Woman

attributes.content: He's gone, but the medicine isn't. Here, do take it. Now, let's talk about your bill...
attributes.name: Calm Mercenary

attributes.content: We accept credit, of course—
attributes.name: Calm Mercenary

attributes.content: We don't.
attributes.name: Figure in the Darkness

attributes.content: Oh, boss. Er... Since when we don't—
attributes.name: Calm Mercenary

attributes.content: Just now. Take her to 'get some rest'.
attributes.name: Figure in the Darkness

attributes.content: Alright. And then?
attributes.name: Calm Mercenary

attributes.content: Send her to the Sineselde. The honorable MPs are waiting for me, aren't they?
attributes.name: Figure in the Darkness

attributes.content: <p=1>The Sineselde, Parliamentary Chamber</><p=2>December 15th, 1098, 5:58 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: Out of the way! Let the doctors work!
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: We've identified the victim, Vina. One Mrs. Lawrence, of Norport.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Are the injures life-threatening?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: No, the vital organs were unharmed. She's just lost a lot of blood. Millscar's people did it.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: But rumors are beginning to spread, and that's not a good thing.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: Her husband, Mickey Robinson, recently passed away from acute Oripathy after being unable to get proper treatment.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: He was one of the Exemplars who came home with us.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: This is her answer.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Escort Mrs. Lawrence to the Defense Forces medical camp, Delphine.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: What about you?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: ...Two more minutes.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: I will keep the word of the provisional court... and my own.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: At Delphine's behest, several MPs carefully carry the unconscious woman out of the Parliamentary Chamber. The carpet on the floor, which has only recently been replaced, is soaked in her blood.
It was the Sarkaz who had bled here two months ago.
There is order on the floor again.
One more minute. There is no one, except two black feathers that seem to be staring at Vina.
They fell from the unconscious woman. As the group carrying her walked past, they were swept up into the air, only to slowly drift down.
That is the place where she should have stood.
The clock strikes six.
It is time. Esteemed members of Parliament, as Millscar has forfeited her right to a defense—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: In accordance with the law, I, Vina Victoria, Speaker of the Parliament of Londinium, pronounce—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: A special warrant is hereby issued for the arrest of Millscar, dead or alive. Defense Forces patrols are to apprehend Millscar personnel by any means necessary.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Effective... immediately.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Also, issue a city-wide announcement that Parliament will accelerate the enactment of the City Safety Act.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: On behalf of Parliament, I vow to the citizens of Londinium that the curfew will be fully lifted within a month, when the reorganization of the police forces is complete.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The provisional court will complete the necessary personnel movement and additions within two months, at which point it will be renamed the Londinium City Court.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The court will continue to process backloaded cases concerning public safety following the conclusion of the war.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Parliament and I will ensure that everyone is treated in a fair and just manner—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Regardless of any privileges that one may have enjoyed, for whatever reason—
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: All shall stand equal before the law.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: What kind of leader do you want to be, Vina?

attributes.content: I... I don't know, Doctor.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: But I should at least know what is right and what is wrong, no?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: Sometimes, right and wrong depend entirely on where you stand.

attributes.content: Then what should I do?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.options: Accept those who despise you, for they keep you vigilant.;Stay true to what you believe in, to help you triumph over solitude.
I learned that from a friend who recently left us.

attributes.content: Bagpipe reporting in. Sweep complete in T-11 and T-32. No sign of Millscar.
attributes.name: Voice from Communicator

attributes.content: How's things over there?
attributes.name: Voice from Communicator

attributes.content: No sign of Millscar in C-11 and C-20, ma'am.
attributes.name: Voice from Communicator

attributes.content: What about L-10? No reports yet?
attributes.name: Voice from Communicator

attributes.content: Reynold? Is there a situation?
attributes.name: Voice from Communicator

attributes.content: I-I'm here!
attributes.name: Trembling Voice

attributes.content: Th-There's nobody here in L-10—
attributes.name: Trembling Voice

attributes.content: His gaze alternates between the purple blade before him and Millscar, imploring for mercy.
(Nods)
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: I-I'm coming back now.
attributes.name: Trembling Voice

attributes.content: Did you find anything useful?
attributes.name: Voice from Communicator

attributes.content: N-No! Nothing at all!
attributes.name: Trembling Voice

attributes.content: The purple blade is lowered. He slowly backs off.
Alright. Meet up at the rendezvous point.
attributes.name: Voice from Communicator

attributes.content: B-Be there in a minute.
attributes.name: Trembling Voice

attributes.content: Leave the communicator.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: O-Okay.
attributes.name: Trembling Voice

attributes.content: He keeps his eyes on Millscar in the shadows. Once he is sure that she is not going to kill him, he drops the communicator, and flees for his life.
<p=1>Cavendish Street, Londinium</><p=2>December 15th, 1098, 9:58 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: So quiet...
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: I prefer the underground. At least the sound there doesn't make me feel—
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Aha.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: Parliament has yet to lift the post-war curfew. They are trying to protect the people... from people like her.
The communicator that she just obtained continues to supply the latest news about the patrols.
Millscar strolls past the shops by the roadside. She hears the faint sound of radio from one of them, and stops before the dimly-lit storefront.
What do you think about Madam Speaker's announcement that the curfew will be lifted in stages as law and order are restored, Hans?
attributes.name: Faint Radio Broadcast

attributes.content: Considering the current pace at which the police and courts are being reorganized? A joke, if you ask me. Who's arresting whom, and who's judging whom?
attributes.name: Faint Radio Broadcast

attributes.content: You don't trust Parliament? Many citizens sleep sounder in their beds, knowing that Parliament has been hard at work rooting out the remaining devils over the past two months.
attributes.name: Faint Radio Broadcast

attributes.content: Today's sweep of underground insurgents has been particularly effective, eliminating another long-term threat to public safety.
attributes.name: Faint Radio Broadcast

attributes.content: In the span of three hours, we have received thousands of messages from citizens expressing their gratitude to Parliament, in particular to our honorable—dare I say, majestic, even—Madam Speaker.
attributes.name: Faint Radio Broadcast

attributes.content: I do not deny that she has been a decisive leader, up till now. How long do you think she can keep it up, though?
attributes.name: Faint Radio Broadcast

attributes.content: I bet you ten pounds that in three months, you wouldn't be able to tell her from those fat, filthy, lying nobles—
attributes.name: Faint Radio Broadcast

attributes.content: Hmph.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: A lavish car stops next to her. The door opens. There is only the driver... and a set of familiar clothing.
She recognizes the emblem of House Cumberland.
You're alive. Her Grace the Duke is willing to recognize your value.
attributes.name: Voice from the Car

attributes.content: She is giving you a chance to come back.
attributes.name: Voice from the Car

attributes.content: Tell her that Cumberland has died.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: And one who has already died once is not afraid to die again.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: The door closes, and the car leaves, disappearing at the end of the street.
Bloody hell... looks like it's not just you who want to kill me, Vina.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: You'd better hurry...
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: She walks silently in the shadows by the side of the street, disappearing into the night.
At least there will be more people who believe that you can give them that most precious, most valuable of things right now—safety.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: I hope you like my final gift to you, Alexandrina...
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.content: After this, we're even.
attributes.name: Millscar

attributes.text: Morale was high before our attack on the Nachzehrer position at the Palace of Westhaleg. Couldn't say the same about the people in the city though.
\nThey had lived for so long under Sarkaz rule that they could hardly even conceive of resistance. Dagda and I found it difficult to persuade able-bodied citizens to join us...
She was wearing an outfit I never thought I would see her in... an outfit for a king. She never said who gave it to her, but we could all guess the answer.
I was dumbfounded. I looked at Dagda, and saw her fighting to contain her trembling.
\nI saw the frenzied crowd rush through streets and alleys, scrambling over one another to join us.
\nThey carried Vina, further and further away from me.
'Her Royal Highness Alexandrina has returned! She'll lead her people to drive out the Sarkaz and take back our home!

attributes.content: <p=1>Cavendish Street, Londinium</><p=2>September 30th, 1098, 9:22 P.M.</>
attributes.name: group_location_stamp

attributes.content: I thought you would reject my proposal.
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: The important thing is to win this final battle. Everything else is secondary.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: The scion of Cumberland yet lives?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I hope so. She deserves a second chance, no matter what.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: What about you? Do you understand the significance of donning this garment?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: I do. But I always had a choice, didn't I?
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: Vina walks through the crowd, escorted by Delphine. Everyone bows to her in reverence.
This is hard to take, though...
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: She thought she saw a certain figure in the crowd, drowned out by the onrushing soldiers and citizens.
What is it?
attributes.name: Delphine

attributes.content: ...Nothing. Let's get the troops in order. It's time to put an end to this.
attributes.name: Vina

attributes.content: 'You and your friends will win, Vina. The present I left you, the garb that always belonged to you, is merely icing on the cake of your final victory.'
'There is no place for me by your side when victory comes. This is the choice that I made.'
'But the end of this absurd war is simply the beginning of your story. Can you remain the ever-victorious legend when that time comes?'
'Victoria is not easily changed by anyone, not even you.'
'But perhaps, I would truly have believed—'
'Goodbye, Vina... Goodbye.'
